Text: Beat Azure Lightning
What's going on!?
I heard you raced my \n little brother the other \n day...
You might've beat him, \n but you won't beat me \n and Azure Lightning!
So you're related to \n that boy from before...
According to my \n calculations, your odds \n of winning are zero!
The only way to test \n those numbers is to \n race, eh?

Not everything comes 
 down to numbers. Your 
 brother learned that 
 with the bird feeder.
My bird won't be \n tempted.
I made sure he had \n plenty to eat!
Y-You did!? How could \n you have possibly have \n known we'd be racing?

Alright, it's time to 
 prove life doesn't 
 always go by the 
 numbers!
I don't think so. You'll \n soon come to learn, \n the numbers never lie!
A flock of birds!?
Lucky me! Now's my chance to win this!
Ah, it's back!
I got trounced...
I was so close!
I did it!
I won! Told you that you \n couldn't trust \n everything to numbers.

Azure Lightning... I 
 didn't count on him 
 getting distracted by a 
 bunch of wild birds.

I guess next time I need 
 to account for more 
 factors in the scope of 
 my mathematical model...
You win, fair \n and square.
But you won't beat my \n brother! He's a living \n legend!
A living legend, eh? \n Sounds like a challenge!
